title: 111_hr899
content: The Act is titled the "Ethical and Legal Elections for Congressional Transitions Act" and requires a special election in case of a vacancy in the office of a Senator. The "Ethical and Legal Elections for Congressional Transitions Act" mandates a special election to fill a Senate vacancy within 90 days of certification by the President of the Senate. A special election to fill a Senate vacancy must be held within 90 days of certification by the President of the Senate, in accordance with applicable state laws. This requirement does not apply if the vacancy occurs near the date of a regularly scheduled election. Scheduled Election.--Subsection (a) does not apply to a Senate vacancy if the President of the Senate issues certification within 90 days of a regularly scheduled general election for the office or before the first day of the next Congress session after the election. Nothing in this section affects a State's authority under the Constitution. The section outlines rules for filling a Senate vacancy, stating that if the President of the Senate certifies within 90 days of a general election or before the next Congress session, a special election is not required. It clarifies that states have the authority to appoint temporary Senators until a special election is held. The Help America Vote Act of 2002 is amended to include payments to reimburse states for costs incurred in holding special elections to fill Senate vacancies. The Commission will make payments to eligible States to cover costs for holding special elections to fill Senate vacancies under the Ethical and Legal Elections for Congressional Transitions Act. States must submit a statement of incurred or anticipated costs to receive payment. The Commission will make payments to States for holding special elections to fill Senate vacancies. States must submit a statement of costs incurred or anticipated, including primary election expenses, to receive 50 percent reimbursement. The Commission will reimburse States for 50 percent of the reasonable costs incurred in holding special elections, with payments made within 30 days of receiving the State's cost statement. No payments will be made for overpayments. No payments will be made for overpayments, and States must agree to repay any excess amount received. Authorization of appropriations for payments under this part for fiscal year 2009 and beyond is granted to the Commission. Additionally, a new section is added to the Help America Vote Act of 2002 for reimbursements of costs incurred in holding special elections to fill Senate vacancies. Payments to States to reimburse portion of costs incurred in holding special elections to fill Senate vacancies. Authorization of appropriations.
